invariants.name: Monotonic hardening direction
invariants.description: Security hardening level can only increase within an epoch; reversal requires a governance artifact with quorum approval.

invariants.name: Evidence emission mandatory
invariants.description: Every policy-driven control action must emit an EvidenceEntry (per bd-nupr schema). Suppression is not a tunable parameter.

invariants.name: Deterministic seed derivation algorithm
invariants.description: The content-derived seed algorithm (SHA-256 over canonical representation) is fixed per version. Controllers cannot substitute alternative hash functions or seed sources.

invariants.name: Integrity proof verification cannot be bypassed
invariants.description: Marker stream hash-chain verification and integrity proof checks run unconditionally. No controller flag can disable them.

invariants.name: Ring buffer overflow policy is FIFO
invariants.description: When the evidence ledger ring buffer is full, the oldest entry is evicted. The eviction order is not policy-tunable.

invariants.name: Epoch boundaries are monotonically increasing
invariants.description: Control epoch IDs must strictly increase. A controller cannot set an epoch ID less than or equal to the current epoch.

invariants.name: Witness reference integrity hashes are SHA-256
invariants.description: All witness_ref digest fields use SHA-256. The hash algorithm is not overridable by policy controllers.

invariants.name: Guardrail precedence over Bayesian recommendations
invariants.description: When a guardrail monitor fires, its decision overrides any Bayesian posterior recommendation. Controllers cannot invert this precedence.

invariants.name: Object class profiles are versioned and append-only
invariants.description: Object class profile definitions are append-only. Existing profile versions cannot be mutated or deleted by policy controllers; only new versions can be added.

invariants.name: Remote capability tokens required for network operations
invariants.description: All network-bound trust and control operations must present a valid RemoteCap token. Controllers cannot grant implicit network access.

invariants.name: Marker stream is append-only
invariants.description: The marker stream is strictly append-only with hash-chain linking. No controller can rewrite, delete, or reorder existing markers.

invariants.name: Decision receipt chain is immutable
invariants.description: Signed decision receipts form a hash-chain that cannot be truncated, modified, or forked by controllers.
